paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.

paragraphs.content: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

paragraphs.content: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

paragraphs.content: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

paragraphs.content: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

paragraphs.content: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

paragraphs.content: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

paragraphs.content: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

paragraphs.content: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

paragraphs.content: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

paragraphs.content: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

paragraphs.content: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
